description:
Before leaving her cram school, Nanako Misonō asks one of the teachers if they can become pen-pals. The teacher, Takehiko Henmi, is reluctant at first, but eventually accepts the offer. The story is narrated through the letters sent from Nanako as she enters Seiran, a renowned private high school for girls only. There she encounters many difficulties as an ordinary middle-class girl invited to the prestigious Sorority, the most traditional and sophisticated club on campus..

(Source: AnimeNewsNetwork)

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Boarding School
tags.description: Features characters attending a boarding school.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Villainess
tags.description: Centers around or prominently features a villainous noble lady.

tags.name: Basketball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of basketball.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

node.description:
Ikeda made her debut in 1967 with [Bara Yashiki no Shoujo](https://anilist.co/manga/111369/Bara-Yashiki-no-Shoujo) in Shoujo Friend when she still was a philosophy student. She was the first to pick up a historic theme in her highly acclaimed [Versailles no Bara](https://anilist.co/manga/30660/Versailles-no-Bara) and did other impressive historical works. She is part of the Year 24 Group. 

It's rumored she had an affair with a politician and Ikeda disappeared from the manga-scene around the mid-80's. However she returned at the end of 1998 again with [Orpheus no Mado Gaiden](https://anilist.co/manga/94262/Orpheus-no-Mado-Gaiden).  

In 2008, Ikeda received France's Ordre national de la Légion d'honneur.

Was a fan of Le Mans.

Dezaki was known for his distinct visual style, which makes use of split screen, stark lighting, extensive use of dutch angle, and pastel freeze frames that he called "postcard memories", which may be his most famous trademark.

Younger brother of director [Satoshi Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/111371). He is married to the mangaka [Rikako Kugayama](https://anilist.co/staff/304119).

Non-anime staff credits:~!
Animation director for "The Visionaries" (US cartoon)
Animation for "Rainbow Brite" (US cartoon)!~

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/杉野昭夫) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akio_Sugino)

A veteran animator with a career spanning over 50 years.

Noted for his work on shows like [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2402/), [Ace wo Nerae!](https://anilist.co/anime/311/), [Nobody's Boy: Remi](https://anilist.co/anime/2828/) and [Treasure Island](https://anilist.co/anime/2618/).

Kei is a Japanese singer that writes and composes his own music, as well as offering it to other musicians. He composed the opening and ending song for at least three seasons of Legend of the Galactic Heroes. Kei graduated from the university of Tokyo and started working with the Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank, and creating music is something he did alongside his regular work.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%BE%BD%E7%94%B0%E5%81%A5%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kentar%C5%8D_Haneda)

Kentarou Haneda was a Japanese pianist, composer and arranger of popular anime and movies and video game music.

After graduating from the Toho Gakuen School of Music, he taught as a professor at the Tokyo College of Music. He was best known as composer of Wizardry music which was ported to NES and SNES console by Ascii at early 1990, The [Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/) series, [Barefoot Gen](https://anilist.co/anime/1824/), Ys Symphony, Symphony Sorcerian and Genso Suikoden Ongaku-shu.

Haneda passed away from liver cancer on June 2, 2007.

(Source: Wikipedia)
